posts.title: Orchards Park Construction Making Progress
posts.content:
Construction at Orchards Park in Bentonville is underway and is estimated to be completed by May or June this year.

  • Inviting: The park will include a children’s playground with designated areas for 2 to 5-year-olds and 5 to 15-year-olds. There will be a dog park adjacent to the playground featuring fenced areas for small and large dogs. Both amenities will be located across from the Crystal Bridges entrance. 
  • Transform: Orchards Park is located at 1100 NE John Deshields Blvd in Bentonville and already features a lake and fountain. The current construction will transform the green space into an active recreation area for the downtown neighborhoods. 

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Benton County Top Earner In Investment Income
posts.content:
Investing in Northwest Arkansas pays off, for life really does work here and the numbers show it. 

  • Gains: According to a recent study, and based on net capital gains, ordinary dividends, and qualified dividends, Benton County residents are receiving the most income nationally from their investments. 
  • Rates: "The study developed an investment index using the three previous metrics that were sourced from IRS data. Benton County’s investment index was 14.36." Statewide, Benton County was followed by Pulaski, and then Washington and Sabastian County.

Read the full Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: Exhibit On Display At Shiloh Museum For Buffalo River's 50th Anniversary
posts.content:
There’s a special exhibit at the Shiloh Museum of Ozark History observing the Buffalo River’s 50 year anniversary of national status. 

  • Scenery: The exhibit is called Ken Smith’s Buffalo River Country and is celebratory of inspiration of the past which came from the scenic Arkansas Ozarks waterway. Smith presents photographs and artifacts from his 1960s survey and exploration of the Buffalo River, all of which played a role in The Ozark Society’s mission to have the Buffalo designated a national river. 
  • On display: There are 24 photos in the exhibit and some personal items of Smith’s, including his camera, portable typewriter, pen and ink illustrations, and tools he used for building trails in ’85 for the first national river. 

For more information and Shiloh exhibits, click HERE.

posts.title: Razorback Football 2022 Dates Released
posts.content:
Get out your pens because some important Razorback football dates for 2022 have been released. 

  • Warming up: Sunday, March 13 will mark Head Coach Sam Pittman’s third season leading the Razorbacks with their first spring 2022 practice. On April 16, Arkansas will host a free, open practice inside Donald W. Reynolds Razorback Stadium, and that date alone could be the public’s only opportunity to see the Hogs on the field this spring. 
  • Kick-off: The Razorbacks will open the 2022 season at home after finishing last season ranked within the AP Top 25. The game is Sept. 3 against Cincinnati. Family weekend is scheduled for Sept. 16-18, the weekend the Hogs will take on Missouri State. 

For season tickets and more information, click HERE.

posts.title: 3 NWA Businesses Made The World's Most Admired Companies List
posts.content:
Fortune’s annual ranking of The World’s Most Admired Companies represents corporate reputations. Three Northwest Arkansas ranked in the top 3 in their respective industry rankings. 

  • This year: Fortune ranked Tyson Foods no. 1 in the world in Food Production. Walmart made the no. 1 spot for General Merchandisers, and J.B. Hunt Transport Services is resting at no. 3 in its industry for the 2022 World’s Most Admired Companies ranking. 
  • Achievements: This is the 6th consecutive year for Tyson Foods to hold the no. 1 spot in Food Production. J.B. Hunt has been recognized on the list 11 times in history. Walmart had the highest ranking of the Arkansas companies, coming in at no. 11 overall.

For Fortune’s full list, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Furry friends: The local beavers at Osage Park wish you to have a 'ice' day.
  • A good life: A Rogers icon who has mailed 100k letters to Coast Guard members dies at 102.
  • Foodie: A few Bentonville restaurants receive a shoutout amidst southern food trends.
  • Catch up: Startup Junkie has a happy hour with trivia today! Check it out!
  • Level up: The longest running stage race in the US, the Joe Martin's Stage Race, is in for some major upgrades.
  • Reach out: We have room for advertisements this spring. Shoot us an email if you're interested in taking some space!
